Name: Bitbucket
Notes: Denies service to Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Sudan and Syria

Name: Buddy
Notes: Cloud version free for 1 project with no limit on size. Self-hosted version free up to 10 users with Fair Source license applied.

Name: GitLab
Developed or used CDE:
GitLab Community Edition (CE) — free software
GitLab Enterprise Edition (EE) — proprietary
Notes: Denies Service to Crimea, Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Sudan, and Syria

Name: GNU Savannah
Notes: Project by the Free Software Foundation and projects with a GPL compatible license. Staff must approve requests for project approval, deletion, and so forth, which can take time if staffing levels are low. Code access review

Name: Helix TeamHub
Developed or used CDE: Cloud version - free up to 5 users. On-premises version requires a license.
Notes: Free cloud version has no limits on projects within 5gb storage limit. On-premises version has DevOps pipeline technology and free replicas.

Name: Launchpad
Notes: Supports Bazaar and Git for version-controlled repository hosting.

Name: Ourproject.org
Notes: For free software, free culture and free content projects.

Name: Rosetta Code
Notes: Programming chrestomathy wiki for common algorithms

Name: SourceForge
Notes: For open-source projects only.Denies service when accessed from Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Sudan, Syria

Name: Visual Studio Team Services
Developed or used CDE: Since IDE Visual Studio 2012 and even Community Edition 2015 fully integrated with Team Services. Also Team Services has Web Interface (CDE).
Notes: Most features are free for teams of 5 members or less
